intro: Galphimia floribunda, commonly known as the yellow flame or Mexican flame flower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow, tubular flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in late spring to early summer. It has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Galphimia floribunda is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soil and full sun.
